description:
Mikhail Vasiliev was sentenced to prison in Canada and faces additional charges in the US for his role in the LockBit ransomware operation.

The post LockBit Ransomware Affiliate Sentenced to Prison in Canada appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: LockBit Ransomware Affiliate Sentenced to Prison in Canada

description:
Lawmakers in the European Parliament voted overwhelmingly in favor of the Artificial Intelligence Act, five years after regulations were first proposed.

The post Europe’s World-First AI Rules Get Final Approval From Lawmakers. Here’s What Happens Next appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Europe’s World-First AI Rules Get Final Approval From Lawmakers. Here’s What Happens Next

description:
Intel and AMD publish 10 new security advisories this Patch Tuesday to inform customers about vulnerabilities impacting their products. 

The post Chipmaker Patch Tuesday: Intel, AMD Address New Microarchitectural Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Chipmaker Patch Tuesday: Intel, AMD Address New Microarchitectural Vulnerabilities

description:
Healthcare has long been a primary target for ransomware attacks. This is not changing and is not likely to change.

The post Healthcare’s Ransomware Epidemic: Why Cyberattacks Hit the Medical Sector With Alarming Frequency appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Healthcare’s Ransomware Epidemic: Why Cyberattacks Hit the Medical Sector With Alarming Frequency

description:
The White House again wants to boost cybersecurity spending, proposing a $3 billion budget for CISA and billions more for other initiatives.

The post White House Budget Proposal Seeks Cybersecurity Funding Boost  appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: White House Budget Proposal Seeks Cybersecurity Funding Boost

description:
Three types of vulnerabilities related to ChatGPT plugins could have led to data exposure and account takeovers. 

The post ChatGPT Plugin Vulnerabilities Exposed Data, Accounts appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: ChatGPT Plugin Vulnerabilities Exposed Data, Accounts

description:
Series E funding of $100 million includes investments from Mitsubishi Electric and Schneider Electric.

The post Nozomi Networks Raises $100 Million to Expand Industrial Cybersecurity Business appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Nozomi Networks Raises $100 Million to Expand Industrial Cybersecurity Business

description:
Stanford University is notifying 27,000 people of a data breach impacting their personal information.

The post Stanford University Data Breach Impacts 27,000 Individuals appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Stanford University Data Breach Impacts 27,000 Individuals

description:
The US seized approximately $1.4 million worth of Tether tokens suspected of being fraud proceeds from tech scams.

The post US Seizes $1.4 Million in Cryptocurrency From Tech Scammers appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: US Seizes $1.4 Million in Cryptocurrency From Tech Scammers

description:
You're invited join SecurityWeek and Gutsy for the webinar, "From Protector to Influencer: CISO Strategies for Boardroom Success," as we address the emerging responsibilities for the CISO role.

The post Webinar Today: CISO Strategies for Boardroom Success appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Webinar Today: CISO Strategies for Boardroom Success

description:
CPU makers Intel, AMD, Arm and IBM, as well as software vendors, are impacted by a new speculative race condition (SRC) attack named GhostRace.

The post Major CPU, Software Vendors Impacted by New GhostRace Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Major CPU, Software Vendors Impacted by New GhostRace Attack

description:
Fortinet has released patches for critical code execution vulnerabilities in FortiOS, FortiProxy, and FortiClientEMS.

The post Fortinet Patches Critical Vulnerabilities Leading to Code Execution appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Fortinet Patches Critical Vulnerabilities Leading to Code Execution

description:
Rockwell Automation hired Stephen Ford as vice VP & CISO, who joins the company from McKesson Corporation, where he was Vice President, Global Security.

The post Rockwell Automation Hires Stephen Ford as Chief Information Security Officer appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Rockwell Automation Hires Stephen Ford as Chief Information Security Officer

description:
The US is spearheading the first United Nations resolution on artificial intelligence, aimed at ensuring the new technology is “safe, secure and trustworthy” and that all countries have equal access.

The post US Spearheads First UN Resolution on Artificial Intelligence appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: US Spearheads First UN Resolution on Artificial Intelligence
